author: James Joyce
text: Dear Sir I thank you for your letter and apologise for delay in replying to it. I have been rather ill with my eyes and could not write. I am much honoured by your kind proposal that I should contribute to your paper and I shall bear it in mind. I regret, however, that for the moment I am allowed to do very little reading or writing but hope that the change of weather may bring me some relief. With renewed thanks, believe me to be, dear sir, Sincerely yours James Joyce
